title: Brandon to Bishop Auckland Railway Path Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Brandon to Bishop Auckland railway path
images.caption: A crossing point on the Brandon to Bishop Auckland railway path, now a popular foot- and cycle-path. The path is followed by National Cycle Network Regional Route 20 Walney to Wear.

description: This is a nice easy cycling and walking path that follows a disused railway line from Brandon, near Durham to Bishop Auckland. You will pass through the villages of Brancepeth and Willington, shortly before joining the River Wear for the final stretch into Bishop Auckland. There are fine views of the surrounding countryside and of the Newton Cap Viaduct just before entering Bishop Auckland. The Lanchester Valley Walk and the Deerness Valley Way pass close to the trail. They are also rail trails with more great views to enjoy.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The route makes up part of the epic W2W Cycle Route - NCN 70. The long distance ride runs from coast to coast from Walney Island in Cumbria to Wearmouth in Sunderland. In nearby Spennymoor you could visit Whitworth Hall Country Park and enjoy afternoon tea at the old country house. There's also lovely parkland and gardens to explore with a large herd of deer you can hand feed.

display_address: Lanchester Valley Walk, Relly Farm, Brandon and Byshottles, Durham, County Durham, North East, England, DH7 7RJ, United Kingdom
